body.name: Her Duke for One Season: A Steamy Historical Regency Romance Novel

productInformation.name: Best Sellers Rank
productInformation.value: #5,764 in Kindle Store (See Top 100 in Kindle Store) #37 in Historical British & Irish Literature #38 in Historical Regency Fiction #55 in Victorian Historical Romance (Kindle Store)

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars One Season, One Love
reviews.reviewText: Lady Grace and Duke Colin agree to a ‘sham’ courting during the season to help each of them further their pursuit of marriage, to anyone else but each other. The two get to know each other, spend time with each other, have quite witty conversations, and fight the attraction to each other. Their obstacles are many, some self-inflicted, some inflicted by friends and family. Lady Grace has a loving but eclectic family. Her mother and father are ‘accepted’ but not up to ‘ton’ standards. Colin, an only child, is struggling with promises he has made to himself and his feelings for Grace. Deception and betrayal by someone close to them surface and cause a confrontation. Family members step up for the couple as Grace and Colin work to tame their doubts, help find trust and allow them to acknowledge their love. Unexpected help comes from a friend and an unexpected acquaintance. Grace and Colin have multiple engagements, smart and witty, sexy and sweet, hot and cold. The storyline is not new, but the characters are engaging, and my heart wanted them to find their way home together. I received an advance review copy for free, and I am leaving this review voluntarily.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Watch As Love Blooms
reviews.reviewText: Colin was intent on marrying but he wanted to marry for convenience and not love. Grace had wanted to marry for love but being the eldest daughter of four sisters she knew she had to marry for convenience. This set the stage for Colin and Grace to court although at first they did not think they were suitable for each other so Grace had made the daring proposition that their courtship should be a fake one until they could each find their perfect match. This was a delightful tale that slowly unleashed the tentacles of love between the two hesitant participants. There was a shocking betrayal that almost thwarted this couple but luckily all worked out as love fully bloomed at the end.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I loved the two main characters in this book! It was a fun concept and fun to read. It is really fun to see how Colin winds up in a situation where he thinks he will have the upper hand and he finds it the opposite way. Grace winds up being more than he had thought and hoped for and she finds him to be more than she bargained for as well. Fun to read and makes you want to get to the end fast so you can see what happens.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 12, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars A sham courtship “helped” by a mutual “friend”
reviews.reviewText: What makes this book the interesting read it is, has to be the two main characters reactions to each other. Colin Johnson, the Duke of Montgomery determined never to love a woman after watching his mother almost mourn to her own death over the loss of his father, decides to seek a wife he’s not physically or emotionally attracted to so there will be no danger of love. Grace Finch the oldest daughter of five daughters of Viscount and Viscountess Crampton feels she must marry a wealthy gentleman to pave the way for her sister’s because of her parent’s unusual ways and irresponsible spending is introduced to Colin by her best friend Margaret. Margaret’s brother William is Colin’s best friend. Colin quickly takes Grace to the dance floor but his fake pleasant personality that he shows to everyone else he drops in the presence of Grace. He even demands a second dance with Grace, a sign of courtship amongst the ton, and the couple, although constantly insulting each other, come to an agreement to enter into a sham courtship. Colin seems to be cruel to Grace but underneath he is the first to begin to fall for her and it’s appears he knows how to manipulate her to gain what he wants but he’s not aware of some conniving individuals determined to break them apart in the end. Colin and Grace keep the story interesting with their unusual courtship and banter back and forth and Grace’s parents add additional humor to the book. I do have an issue with the cover of the book. It appears to me that the male is wearing a too modern of a suit for this time period.I received a free Advanced Readers’ Copy of this book but was given no monetary compensation. I read for the enjoyment and voluntarily review so that others may know what to expect and authors may be helped by critique and encouragement.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I enjoyed this book so much, the interactions between Colin and Grace made me laugh. The way they went back and forth, all while getting to know each other and grow on each other. Even though the fake courtship ruse has been written about before, this feels fresh.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Power Play Winner in Love
reviews.reviewText: This spellbinding story is worth a second read. Who is the villain? Not whom you expect. Who is in charge? Smart mouth comments make it hard to know. Is this story line worth it? Absolutely! A must read.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great storyline with true love emerging.
reviews.reviewText: Grace and Colin were a true match. Margaret, a friend, certainly surprised me in the end. This was a great read. Highly recommend.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Nothing new about this plot. Two people try to fool the ton and fall in love. What is new is the wit and banter between the two. Colin has learned to be pleasant but emotionally distant. Grace has a family that doesn't fit the mold. Together, you will find humor and entertainment for a relaxing afternoon of a romantic story.

Grace and Colin's story was sweet. They had amazing chemistry. I loved grace's family and how loving they were towards each other. Colin and Grace manage to get into each other hearts. Colin a duke, grace a lady with an unconventional family learn that love conquers.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on February 9, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: KEEP YOUR FRIENDS CLOSE & YOUR ENEMIES CLOSER (OK IF YOU KNOW WHO THEY ARE) ??
reviews.reviewText: DUKE COLIN - A man who had grown up with so much love and respect by his parents - his world changed when his father died his mother changed overnight at one point he thought he would loose her as well, he still visits his fathers grave and remembers his promise to continue the family name (He decides to take a wife but there will be no love) he cannot take the pain again of losing someone you love, he begins his search at the start of the season attending most functions.LADY GRACE - aware people talk about her family her mother and father are quite the odd couple (outrageous - in as much as they show their feelings to each other - dress as they want too and spend lots of money which people believe they have not got and they love their children very much).Grace would never let her parents know that their behaviour is why she has no suitors (She protects her family) she has decided to find and approach a gentleman with an offer of a fake courting for a season.Her best and ONLY FRIEND MARGARET is attending the function she lets her know what she plans to do.LET THE GAMES BEGIN.!I ABSOLUTELY LOVE THIS - IT HAS EVERYTHING LOVED HER FAMILY THE QUIRKINESS OF HER PARENTS AND HER SISTERS.THE INTERACTION BETWEEN COLIN AND GRACE IS HOT AND COMPLICATED(AND DANGEROUS) !I RECEIVED AN ARC

Grace and Colin's story shows that what you need isn't necessarily what you want. When you start off with animosities, it's hard to admit (mostly to yourself) that your judgement was wrong and you are slowly but surely falling for the enemy.
What a great book, it was funny, full of banter and a bit sad too when Grace and Colin broke up. I thoroughly enjoyed reading Colin and Grace love story.

I liked the book. The plot is nice with some twists and turns. The main characters are likable. I particularly enjoyed their playful banters and biting remarks, as well as the steamy chemistry between them.Grace, who is ashamed of her parents' unconventional behaviour, must find a husband to secure her sisters' prospects, and her mind is set on Viscount Repington.Colin is looking for a agreeable wife to please his mother, but he is determined to choose one he won't fall in love with.When they meet at a ball, he proposes to her and she refuses. But she soon realises that a fake courtship with him is the best way to overcome society's rejection of her family, even though she loathes him for his jocular behavior...If you like witty historical romances with witty dialogues, a touch of steam and mystery, you will enjoy this book.
